page.title: 12TENDRINGS FARM (HOUSE)
page.content: The house that is currently standing was built in the 1500's. At that time a{man-made moat}surrounded the house to provide water. The roof was probably thatched however it has now been tiled for several years. The walls show {extensive pargetting}and one of the walls has been re-pargetted owing to {World War II damage.}There is still a bomb crater in a nearby copse. The house is now used as a family home. It has 3 reception rooms and a kitchen downstairs with 3 bedrooms and a boxroom upstairs. The kitchen has an {'Aga'}which stands in an old fire- place. There is lots of old furniture including a 300 year old{linen press and a{Victorian knife sharpener and {cleaner.}There is now electricity and mains water at the house but this was not connected until 1955.
